amendment.description: To improve education in the United States by providing $300,000,000 for the Teacher Incentive Fund to support State and local school district efforts to reward outstanding teaching and school leadership by improving compensation programs for teachers who have a demonstrated record of improving student academic achievement, teachers who teach in high need subjects such as mathematics and science, and teachers who teach in high need, low income schools.

vote.text: Amendment SA 4311 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Amendment SA 4311 proposed by Senator Conrad for Senator Alexander. (consideration: CR 3/14/2008 S2078-2080; text: CR 3/14/2008 S2079) To improve education in the United States by providing $300,000,000 for the Teacher Incentive Fund to support State and local school district efforts to reward outstanding teaching and school leadership by improving compensation programs for teachers who have a demonstrated record of improving student academic achievement, teachers who teach in high need subjects such as mathematics and science, and teachers who teach in high need, low income schools.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 4311 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
